sentence.text: Smad3, a major transcription factor in transforming growth factor-β (TGF-β) signaling, plays critical roles in both tumor-suppressive and pro-oncogenic functions.

However, recent discoveries of Smad3-interacting molecules that preferentially bind phosphorylated Smad3 linker serine/threonine residues have shown a multitude of signal transductions that either enhance or suppress TGF-β responses associated with Smad3 turnover or cancer progression.
